column4: Like hoe majority of KDE application's config/settings are stored in ~/.kde , where are GNOME application settings stored?
are you sure? most kde apps store config in ~/.config or ~/.local, where as most gnome strict applications store config in either gconf or ~/.gnome2
you might even find that some gtk applications store their config in ~/.config
I'm searching for settings stored by gworldclock
if it's too much output then pipe it through less: locate gworldclock | grep /home/$USER | less
There is no o/p at all from that comman
have you run the program yet ?
have you looked at the manpage for the program?
Yes, nothing useful in it to be used for my current need
I want to see the settings file

I've used this package before and had saved certain timezones. Now, I'm on different system but I've the copy of old home and /etc of the system on which it was used. So, I'm unable to locate the config folders or settings folder for the app, to restore it on my current system so that I don't have reconfigure again
I've seen it from terminal using man gworldclock
not sure what to say, i'd look at the files it describes in ther
